title: The Walking Dead season 10 episode 4: Questions we have after Negan goes missing
text:
Negan is on the loose and it seems there’s a new enemy (Picture: AMC)

The next installment of The Walking Dead might have started off as a slow burner, but it sure had us gripped by the end of the episode.

We’re finally back at The Hilltop, but while there seems to be a new enemy on the loose our people are losing sight of what’s going on outside of the walls, as there’s much turmoil within.

Lydia has made a comeback, and is struggling to find her place while Siddiq is still getting to grips with life after the season nine massacre.

And it seems there’s still much hatred surrounding Negan – especially after he went and killed one of the team while saving Lydia from a beating.

But before we get into that, here’s a number of questions we have following Silence The Whisperers.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Who is the new enemy?

Who is threatening the communities? (Picture: AMC)

Last week saw a herd of zombies unleashed onto Alexandria, and while Michonne was left thinking it was Alpha who had started war against or OG group – we’re not too sure.

After bringing down one threat, The Hilltop were then faced with a fallen tree that brought down part of their wall.

Not only this, but the sound of it cascading down attracted hundreds of walkers to the community.

Luke and his gang rushed outside of the wall to protect their people, but were overrun by the dead and had to come back inside.

Following the fight, it was then revealed that another trap had been set on Oceanside – seeing Michonne team up with Luke, and her bambino Judith, to go and save their friends.

But Alpha appears to have softened and doesn’t want to harm her enemies while they still have her daughter Lydia in their grasp, making us almost convinced there’s a new bad guy on the scene.

Is Luke going to die?

Has Luke said his final farewells (Picture: AMC)

It pains us to write this question, as Luke is one of our solid favourite faces of the series, however we can’t help but feel that this episode was setting up his departure.

The loved member of The Hilltop said his farewells to his people as he excitedly hopped into the car on his way to help Oceanside.

And you know when you have that gut feeling that this is the last time you’re going to see someone.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Well we sure got those vibes, as happy music played in the background as he set off to go and meet his crush.

It was almost too happy, and too calm for The Walking Dead – meaning it must be too good to be true.

Goodbye Luke.

Will Lydia and Siddiq team up?

Is Siddiq hiding more than we think? (Picture: AMC)

There are a number of theories circling Siqqiq at the moment, with one being he is secretly working for Alpha and only managed to escape because he committed the beheadings back in season nine.

While we know he is suffering with PTSD, it’s almost as if he is hiding something alongside his illness.

And if rumours prove true, and Lydia finds out, the pair might just plot their revenge and escape together.

Lydia was seen beaten to the ground by members of The Hilltop, and almost lost her life before Negan stepped in and saved her.

But there’s not much keeping the character at the community, not since Henry died anyway, and maybe at this point she might want to return to her Whisperer mother.

Could Siddiq be her escape? And is he working for the enemy?

Where did Negan go and who let him free?

Where on Earth has Negan gone? (Picture: AMC)

In the comics, Negan escapes his prison, runs away, and that’s basically that.

But we know Scott Gimple won’t allow the Saviour to be off our screens for too long – he’s just too good to let go.

Advertisement

After he saved Lydia, Negan was sent back to his cell, as he also ended up killing one of the group who was beating the ex-Whisperer.

And while the people of The Hilltop were calling for his execution, Daryl Dixon stepped in and expressed how his former enemy was actually doing the right thing.

While we have no idea where he has escaped to, we can’t help but think Daryl let Negan out of his cage in an attempt to save his life.

As he sure won’t allow Lydia to take the flack for it.

Is Carol going to run away?

Will Carol leave behind her people for a clean break (Picture: AMC)

Carol revealed on three occasions how unhappy she was at The Hilltop.

When talking to her bestie Daryl, she joked with the original group member that they should have run away to New Mexico when they had the chance.

She also made reference to time standing still, as people have yet to get over the whole Negan drama (not like he didn’t kill their family members or anything).

But while that might have just been your average post-apocalyptic chit chat, the final scene shows Carol standing on her balcony and glaring into the distance with a map in her hand.

While we were convinced that she would be the one to take down Alpha – after she killed Carol’s son Henry – maybe the mourning mother has just had enough and wants a clean break.

Advertisement

It wouldn’t be the first time she has tried to run away – and she quite liked it back then – so what’s stopping her now?

The Walking Dead continues Sunday on AMC in the US and follows a day later here in the UK.

description: The Walking Dead season 10 episode 4: Questions we have after Negan goes missing.
